text: I heard somewhere that it’s possible to use <https://www.npmjs.com/package/ember-source> today, in place of the bower package. Anyone got the trufax?
dunno <@U03V8V08M> ... wonder if you'd get a response on the global site?
<@U04BD6KB1> <@U044QMK6K> assures me it is so

Random survey for folks ... if you're getting a new Mac Laptop do you:

a) install apps on fresh build
b) migrate from a timemachine backup (aka, roll your old laptop forward)
i don't look forward to re-installing everything but I'm glad others are pointing me in that direction
it does feel a lot cleaner
<@U044QMK6K> <@U03V8V08M> any good examples/docs for ember-source?
it’s a good moment to re-assess which programs are essential
yes minimalism is important (and finding time for minimalism)
also a good time to find out where one is still dependent on non-cloud storage
yes pre-cloud world was a tough environment

i still distinctly remember my first _aha moment_ for cloud when I lost a laptop on the first leg of a business trip and had to "recover" remotely for two weeks of meetings on a netbook bought on the fly. That it was even possible was a shock to me.
<@U04BD6KB1> do you use iCloud for photos?
I went through a phase of installing apps through brew, then you can script the fresh install
i'm on Dropbox for most things (including photos)
<@U04BD6KB1> I don’t know much about ember-source, just seen that various PRs have been merged in recent days
i still really only use iCloud for very Apple exclusive things (like backups)

* <https://github.com/emberjs/ember.js/pull/13022> - provide ember-core from NPM
* <https://github.com/emberjs/ember.js/pull/14556> - Use npm for rsvp instead of bower
* <https://github.com/emberjs/ember.js/pull/14570> - Update router to npm

text: <@U044QMK6K> thanks i'll dig into those on my next break
We're working on a yarn PR to support private repos at which point we'll be migrating over. Then the more that moves from bower to npm the better. Fingers crossed.
<@U04TVTLQ8>, have a question for you ... how do you see Shippable versus Bitbucket's Pipeline's stacking up?
<@U04BD6KB1> not sure yet. About to play with pipeline
<@U04TVTLQ8> would be interested in your opinion; you're much more of a power user than I
anyone seen this error in your CI for beta-builds `Cannot instantiate a component without a renderer.`
i've never seen that
looking fwd to sharing my crazy code at the next meetup!
<@U04BD6KB1>: yup I had that error when trying to do `component.append` in an ancient unit test
ok, let me see if I can find the same thing in my component ... it was definitely in the "unit" versus "integration" default days
